line.comment: * PIRACY: USER INTERFACE LIBRARY -by- MISTER BEAR v1.45 Jan-2011
* DESCRIPTION: Functions for altering UI components
* COMMA DELIMIT NUMBER : Comma delimit a number and optionally format
* ARGUMENT 1 : [int/string] Number or string to comma delimit
* ARGUMENT 2 : [int] [Optional] Formatting: 1:Price 2:Laser/Shield strength [Assumes value is specified in kJ]
* Validate parameters and ensure 'i' is the integer version of 'xArgument1'
* Condense values in joules by re-expressing them using the largest possible units
* Check if can be expressed in GJ
* Check if can be expressed in MJ
* CREATE OBJECT CLASS STRING : Convert an object class enumeration to a string
* NOTE : This function will return null for non-ship object classes. See pageID 2006 for more objclass definitions.
* Convert object class to integer NOTES: TM:2141 M8:2142 PirateTS:2035 Astronaut:2064
* Convert object class integer to array index
* Special cases: Pirate-TS/TL and TM/M8 respectively. Convert IDs manually
* CREATE TRANSPORT CLASS STRING : Get the short transport class string for a ware
* CREATE LIST ITEM : Interlace a sub-item position array with a sub-item text array
* Colour sub-item string or create sub-item string from integer
* CREATE LIST ITEM HEADER : Create a list item and add it to a custom menu as a heading
* COLOUR LIST ITEM : Colour only the text elements of a custom menu 'list item' array.
* DEBUG MENU : Create a menu and display up to three values
* FIRST ITEM: Convert value to string. Add item.
* SECOND ITEM: Convert value to string. Add item.
* Add OK Button and display menu
* PLAY SPEECH : Play a specified phrase
* PLAY VIDEO : Play video and associated a sound file with it
* ARGUMENT 1 - [object] Ship sending player this message
* ARGUMENT 2 - [int] VIDEO ID of Video file (from Videos.pck)
* ARGUMENT 3 - [int] PAGE ID of associated sound file
* ARGUMENT 4 - [int] TEXT ID of associated sound file
* FORCE VIDEO : Force video for number of seconds by playing a dummy sound file.
* ------------- NOTE: Used for sounds the above function wont play.
* ARGUMENT 1 - [object] Ship sending player this message
* ARGUMENT 2 - [int] FILE ID of Video file (from Videos.pck)
* ARGUMENT 3 - [int] Length of time to display video (in seconds)
* CHOOSE SPECIFIC SOUND FILE BASED ON REQUESTED VIDEO LENGTH
* SET VIDEO FILE and DUMMY AUDIO FILE

sval.val: PIRACY: USER INTERFACE LIBRARY -by- MISTER BEAR v1.45 Jan-2011
DESCRIPTION: Functions for altering UI components
COMMA DELIMIT NUMBER : Comma delimit a number and optionally format
ARGUMENT 1 : [int/string] Number or string to comma delimit
ARGUMENT 2 : [int] [Optional] Formatting: 1:Price 2:Laser/Shield strength [Assumes value is specified in kJ]
Validate parameters and ensure 'i' is the integer version of 'xArgument1'
Condense values in joules by re-expressing them using the largest possible units
Check if can be expressed in GJ
Check if can be expressed in MJ
CREATE OBJECT CLASS STRING : Convert an object class enumeration to a string
NOTE : This function will return null for non-ship object classes. See pageID 2006 for more objclass definitions.
Convert object class to integer NOTES: TM:2141 M8:2142 PirateTS:2035 Astronaut:2064
Convert object class integer to array index
Special cases: Pirate-TS/TL and TM/M8 respectively. Convert IDs manually
CREATE TRANSPORT CLASS STRING : Get the short transport class string for a ware
CREATE LIST ITEM : Interlace a sub-item position array with a sub-item text array
Colour sub-item string or create sub-item string from integer
CREATE LIST ITEM HEADER : Create a list item and add it to a custom menu as a heading
COLOUR LIST ITEM : Colour only the text elements of a custom menu 'list item' array.
DEBUG MENU : Create a menu and display up to three values
FIRST ITEM: Convert value to string. Add item.
SECOND ITEM: Convert value to string. Add item.
Add OK Button and display menu
PLAY SPEECH : Play a specified phrase
PLAY VIDEO : Play video and associated a sound file with it
ARGUMENT 1 - [object] Ship sending player this message
ARGUMENT 2 - [int] VIDEO ID of Video file (from Videos.pck)
ARGUMENT 3 - [int] PAGE ID of associated sound file
ARGUMENT 4 - [int] TEXT ID of associated sound file
FORCE VIDEO : Force video for number of seconds by playing a dummy sound file.
------------- NOTE: Used for sounds the above function wont play.
ARGUMENT 1 - [object] Ship sending player this message
ARGUMENT 2 - [int] FILE ID of Video file (from Videos.pck)
ARGUMENT 3 - [int] Length of time to display video (in seconds)
CHOOSE SPECIFIC SOUND FILE BASED ON REQUESTED VIDEO LENGTH
SET VIDEO FILE and DUMMY AUDIO FILE
